ans.reasoning: The method increments the iteration counter and throws a MaxCountExceededException if the maximum number of iterations is exceeded. This is directly related to the stack trace indicating that the maximal count was exceeded, making it highly suspicious.

This method performs an iteration of the Simplex algorithm and calls incrementIterationsCounter. Since the exception is thrown when the maximum iterations are exceeded, this method is also suspicious as it is part of the iteration process.

This method checks if the optimization is optimal by examining the tableau entries. If the tableau is not set up correctly, it could lead to an infinite loop or excessive iterations, indirectly contributing to the issue.

This method normalizes constraints but does not seem to directly relate to the iteration count or optimization process. However, if the constraints are not normalized correctly, it could lead to issues in the optimization process.

This method initializes the optimization process but does not directly contribute to the iteration count or the exception thrown. It is the least suspicious as it primarily sets up the optimization parameters.
